sentences.sentence: Suddenly the Dwarf( 小矮人 ) realized he was not alone.
Standing in the doorway( 门口 ) at the other end of the room, he saw a little figure watching him.
His heart began to beat quickly, and a cry of happiness came from his lips( 嘴唇 ), and he moved out into the sunlight.
As he did so, the figure moved out also, and he saw it clearly.
The Infanta( 公主 )! But she looked like a monster( 怪物 ), the most horrible( 可怕的 ) monster( 怪物 ) he had ever seen.
The monster( 怪物 ) had a crooked( 弯曲的 ) back, and twisted( 扭曲变形的 ) arms and legs, and a huge head, and thick and ugly black hair.
The little Dwarf( 小矮人 ) frowned( 皱眉 ), and the monster( 怪物 ) frowned( 皱眉 ) also.
He laughed, and it laughed with him, and held its hands to its sides, just as he himself was doing.
He went toward it, and it came to meet him, copying each step that he made, and stopping when he stopped.
He reached out his hand, and the hand of the monster( 怪物 ) touched his, and it was as cold as ice.
He tried to get closer to the monster( 怪物 ), but something smooth and hard stopped him.
The face of the monster( 怪物 ) was now close to his own, and seemed very afraid.
He stepped back from the monster( 怪物 ), and took the beautiful white rose out of his pocket, and he turned round, and kissed it.
The monster( 怪物 ) had a rose of its own, exactly the same!
The monster( 怪物 ) kissed its rose also, and its face looked horrible( 可怕的 ) as it did so.
When the Dwarf( 小矮人 ) realized the truth, he screamed( 尖叫 ) and fell to the ground.
So it was him, with a crooked( 弯曲的 ) back, and twisted( 扭曲变形的 ) arms, and a huge head, and thick and ugly hair.
He himself was the monster( 怪物 ), and all the children had been laughing at him.
The little Infanta( 公主 ), who he had thought loved him, had only been laughing at his ugliness.
Why had the soldiers( 士兵 ) not left him in the forest, where there was no mirror( 镜子 ) to show him how ugly he was?
The little Dwarf( 小矮人 ) began to wish he had never been born.
The hot tears( 眼泪 ) flowed( 流淌 ) down his face, and he tore( 撕碎 ) the white rose to pieces.
The monster( 怪物 ) did the same, and threw the white petals in the air.
When he looked at it, its face looked like it was in pain.
He turned away, and covered his eyes with his hands, so that he would not have to look at it any longer.
Then he lay down on the ground, and he cried bitterly( 伤心地 ).
And at that moment the Infanta( 公主 ) herself came in with her friends through an open window.
When they saw the ugly little Dwarf( 小矮人 ) lying on the ground, and beating the floor with his hands, they all began to laugh loudly.
They all came up close to him, and stood all around him and watched him.
“His dancing was funny,” said the Infanta( 公主 ).
“But his acting is even funnier.
In fact, he is almost as good as the puppets, although of course not quite so natural.”
And she waved( 挥动 ) her large fan, and clapped( 鼓掌 ).
But the little Dwarf( 小矮人 ) never looked up, and his crying grew quieter and quieter.
Suddenly he breathed out( 呼气 ) very quickly, and grabbed( 抓 ) his chest( 胸膛 ).
Then he fell back again, and lay quite still.
“That is excellent,” said the Infanta( 公主 ), after a moment.
“But now you must dance for me.”
“Yes,” cried all the children, “you must get up and dance, for you are as clever as the monkeys, and much more ridiculous( 可笑的 ).”
But the little Dwarf( 小矮人 ) did not answer.
And the Infanta( 公主 ) stamped her foot, and called out to her uncle, who was walking by just outside the doorway( 门口 ).
“My funny little Dwarf( 小矮人 ) is sleeping,” she cried, “you must wake him up, and tell him to dance for me.”
The King’s brother smiled, and he walked in, and reached down, and slapped( 拍打 ) the Dwarf( 小矮人 ) on the face with his glove.
“You must dance,” he said. “Little man. You must dance.
The Infanta( 公主 ) wants to laugh.”
But the little Dwarf( 小矮人 ) never moved.
The King’s brother began to look more serious, and he put his hand on the little Dwarf( 小矮人 )’s heart.
After a few moments he stood up, and spoke to the Infanta( 公主 ).
“Beautiful Princess( 公主 ), your funny little Dwarf( 小矮人 ) will never dance again.”
“But why will he not dance again?” asked the Infanta( 公主 ), laughing.
“Because his heart is broken,” he answered.
The Infanta( 公主 ) frowned( 皱眉 ), and her red lips( 嘴唇 ) twisted( 撅起 ) like the petals of a dying rose.
“From now on, only those who have no hearts may come to play with me,” she cried, and she ran out into the garden.

article_info.previous: 矮人畅想着与公主一起在森林里漫步跳舞，于是开始四处寻找公主。无意中他跑进了王宫大殿，却一无所获。随后他来到一间明亮且华丽的房间，在这里他有什么发现呢？
article_info.share_words: After a few moments he stood up, and spoke to the Infanta. “Beautiful Princess, your funny little Dwarf will never dance again.”“But why will he not dance again?” asked the Infanta, laughing.“Because his heart is broken,” he answered.

question.cn: 矮人一进房间就注意到什么？
question.en: What did the Dwarf notice when he entered the room?

options.cn: 他注意到他不是一个人。
options.en: He noticed that he was not alone.

options.cn: 他注意到公主也在那里。
options.en: He noticed that the Infanta was there.
He noticed that the King was there.

analysis: 文中提到“Suddenly the Dwarf realized he was not alone. Standing in the doorway at the other end of the room, he saw a little figure watching him.”因此本题选A。

options.cn: 他看到在公主对他微笑。
options.en: He saw the Infanta smiling at him.

options.cn: 他看到一个可怕的怪物。
他看到一个英俊的男人。

analysis: 文中提到“The Infanta! But she looked like a monster, the most horrible monster he had ever seen. The monster had a crooked back, and twisted arms and legs, and a huge head, and thick and ugly black hair.”矮人以为那是公主，但看起来却是一个可怕的怪物，本题选B。
文中提到“So it was him, with a crooked back, and twisted arms, and a huge head, and thick and ugly hair. He himself was the monster, and all the children had been laughing at him.”本题选B。

question.cn: 当矮人得知真相后发生了什么？
question.en: What happened to the Dwarf when he found out the truth?

options.en: He ran back to the forest.

analysis: 文中提到“But the little Dwarf never moved. ‘Beautiful Princess, your funny little Dwarf will never dance again.' 'Because his heart is broken.’”因此本题选C。

share_title: 100天读完3本英文书，今天是第44天
